intro: Chrysocephalum podolepideum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf golden weed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its golden-yellow flowers that bloom in dense, compact heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. It is a hardy perennial that is often used in coastal landscaping due to its resilience and ornamental value.
